description:
When Quantum is enabled the API driver (nova.network.quantumv2.api.Api) executes allocate_for_instance for creating Quantum ports and building the network_info data structure which is then reused throughout the spawn process.

Ports are created in the order specified by _get_available_networks, which at the moment could either be all the networks accessible to the tenant, or the just the networks he/she requested using the --nic options (ie: the multinic extension, if I'm not wrong).
However, the network_info data structure is then built invoking _build_network_info_model, which invokes a GET /ports on quantum. This function builds the data structure in the same order as the ports returned by the Quantum server, rather than the order specified by _get_available_networks.
As there is no guarantee that the order of the ports returned by quantum is the same as the order specified by _get_available_networks, it is possible that Nics are then attached to the VM in an order different from the one expected to the user, and there is also a chance this order might be different for different VMs using the same networks.

Please note that this bug is not a duplicate of bug 1042348, although they are somewhat related.

A simple fix could consist in building network_info using the order specified by _get_available_networks
title: Nic Ordering not guaranteed with Quantum API

Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 9e40f9cb239e6348432451eaf87a04e59016ea18
Author: Mark McClain <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Oct 30 23:54:45 2012 -0400

    make QuantumV2 support requested nic ordering
    
    fixes bug 1064524
    
    The QuantumV2 did not honor nic ordering, so nics were attached in
    Quantum's db natural order.  This patch sorts the networks honor requested nic
    ordering when Nova calls the V2Quantum API.  Unit tests have been updated to
    confirm ordering is honored.
    
    Change-Id: I44a6a4736c78e86e83b6e682e63f93a5b47652da

Hello Salvatore, or anyone else affected,

Accepted nova into quantal-proposed. The package will build now and be available at http://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/nova/2012.2.1+stable-20121212-a99a802e-0ubuntu1 in a few hours, and then in the -proposed repository.

Please help us by testing this new package.  See https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/EnableProposed for documentation how to enable and use -proposed.  Your feedback will aid us getting this update out to other Ubuntu users.

If this package fixes the bug for you, please add a comment to this bug, mentioning the version of the package you tested, and change the tag from verification-needed to verification-done. If it does not fix the bug for you, please add a comment stating that, and change the tag to verification-failed.  In either case, details of your testing will help us make a better decision.

Further information regarding the verification process can be found at https://wiki.ubuntu.com/QATeam/PerformingSRUVerification .  Thank you in advance!
